Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was allegedly choked by Staff 1.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 11/15/2023 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. No additional
information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/17/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Youth A stated Staff 1 attempted to choke him. Youth A
stated that everything began because he was walking around the
common area and individual offices nearby when he was
supposed to be in school one morning. Youth A recalled that he
went into the small staff break room that is near the front door of
the facility. Youth A recalled Staff 1 coming in the room from the
other side. Youth A stated that he initially did not listen to Staff 1‘s
request to leave the room. Youth A stated that Staff 1 then
grabbed the front of his shirt as well as the back of his shirt and
while facing each other, Staff 1 pushed Youth A back into the
corner of the room. At this point, Youth A recalled Staff 1 having
his forearm in Youth A‘s neck while they were on the wall, for
about 10 seconds. Youth A stated that at some point Staff 2
entered the room as well. Youth A recalled dropping to the floor
and then leaving the break room after Staff 1 let go of him. Youth
A stated that he did not feel any pain or difficulty breathing while
Staff 1 had his hands on him. Youth A then stated that right before
he left, Staff 3 came into the room as well. Youth A stated that
Staff 1 did not say anything else after the initial request to leave
the room. Youth A also recalled Staff 2 telling Staff 1 “Stop, man”
when Staff 2 first entered the room. Youth A stated that he was
not supposed to be in that room in the first place, and that the
door to it was locked but he was able to “shoulder check” it and
get it open. Youth A did not believe any other youth saw what
occurred because everyone else was in class.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/01/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Staff 2 recalled following Youth A throughout the building.
Staff 2 recalled Youth A was escalated, mostly that he was
wandering around and entering areas he was not supposed to be.
Staff 2 recalled that Youth A went through the door that enters the
staff break room, and that Staff 1 followed him. Staff 2 confirmed
2

that this room is intended to be locked and is off limits to youth.
Staff 2 stated that he went in the other door to enter the room.
Staff 2 stated that when he entered the room, Staff 1 was standing
near the wall blocking a time clock that is mounted on the wall. He
stated that he and Staff 1 attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth
A. Staff 2 stated that Youth A walked out of the room and Staff 2
heard him say “That motherfucker tried to choke me out.” Staff 2
stated that he saw Youth A reaching up past Staff 1 toward the
time clock when he first entered the room. Staff 2 stated that he
did not see Staff 1 have his hands on Youth A, nor did he see any
choking when he entered the room. He stated that the entire time
that they spent in the room was 2 to 3 minutes. Staff 2 recalled
that Staff 3 came into the room right before Youth A left. Staff 2
reiterated that he did not see anyone with their hands on another
person during his time in the room.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Staff 1 recalled finishing his night shift, and in the process
of speaking with some other staff and getting ready to leave when
he saw that Youth A was escalated and moving around the
building when he should have been in school. Staff 1 recalled
seeing Youth A lock himself in the staff break room. Staff 1 stated
that he took it upon himself to go around the other door to the
break room to see what Youth A was doing. When Staff 1 entered
the break room, no one else was in there other than Youth A. Staff
1 recalled Youth A attempting to break the time clock off the wall.
Staff 1 stated that he asked Youth A to stop doing this several
times, but he felt very quickly that Youth A was not going to stop.
Staff 1 recalled using an approved restraint model hold in an
attempt to prevent Youth A from breaking the time clock off of the
wall. Staff 1 stated that he grabbed Youth A by his waist from
behind and attempted to turn him around and away from the wall.
Staff 1 recalled that this caused Youth A to turn around and face
Staff 1. Staff 1 then recalled that Youth A bent over and Staff 1 felt
like Youth A was attempting to pick Staff 1 up off the ground. Staff
1 stated that this physical contact only lasted for a few seconds
when Staff 2 and Staff 3 came into the room. One of Staff 2 and
Staff 3, he could not remember who, stated “Let him go.” Staff 1
believed that whoever said this was attempting to tell Youth A to
let Staff 1 go. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A then let go and he
walked out of the room. Staff 1 stated that this was his last contact
with Youth A that day and he confirmed that he was under a
current safety plan to not have contact with Youth A at this time.
Staff 1 stated that he did not see any bruises or injuries to Youth A
during this incident. Staff 1 denied ever hearing Youth A say
3

anything about being choked. Staff 1 confirmed that Youth A was
not able to pull the time clock off of the wall. He stated that there
was a good amount of disarray in the room already, with things
flipped off of a table and posters pulled off the wall. Staff 1
believed that Youth A did this before he entered the room. In
discussing the hands-on portion of the incident more, Staff 1
stated that he did not have his hands on Youth A other than how it
was described. Staff 1 did not believe his arm ever came up to
Youth A‘s neck in anyway. Staff 1 stated that he may have
grabbed the back of Youth A‘s arms as Youth A was bent over
and attempting to pick up Staff 1, but he could not perfectly recall
that. Staff 1 stated that he is trained to intervene in the destruction
of property in case it can cause any injury to a youth or staff. Staff
1 denied ever bear-hugging Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 12/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He stated that he came into the room when Staff 1, Youth
A, and Staff 2 were present, and Youth A began to walk out. Staff
3 stated that he heard Staff 1 redirecting Youth A verbally when
he entered the room, but he could not recall what Staff 1 said.
Staff 3 stated that he did hear Staff 2 say “Let him go” and saw
Staff 2 stand in between Staff 1 and Youth A in the corner of the
room before Youth A walked out. Staff 3 stated that he heard
Youth A say “That motherfucker choked me” later when Youth A
was in one of the staff offices recounting the incident.
Therapist was interviewed on 12/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
and Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit to
the facility. She stated that she had a session with Youth A later in
the morning on the day of the incident. Youth A did not mention
anything about being in pain, about what potentially occurred, or
anything about an alleged incident involving Staff 1.
Documents reviewed:
• A safety plan dated 11/15/2023 was provided. This stated
that Staff 1 was not to work alone with Youth A and was
always to be at least arm’s length away from Youth A when
in his presence.
• No discipline was noted in Staff 1’s personnel file at the
beginning of the investigation. Recent discipline was
provided dated 12/12/2023 where it was confirmed that
Staff 1’s employment was terminated because of the
incident in question and the “inappropriate child handling
technique with a client in care.”
4

• An incident report dated 11/16/2023 regarding the
11/15/2023 incident was reviewed. It was described that
Youth A broke line of sight of staff when he was supposed
to be in school on the morning of 11/15/2023. He
eventually got into the staff break room where Staff 1 met
him. At that point Youth A was attempting to break the time
clock off of the wall. Staff 1 asked Youth A to stop, and
when he did not Staff 1 used what was described as a
“breaking up a fight” restraint hold by placing his hands on
Youth A’s waist. It further described that Youth A charged
at Staff 1 and tried to pick him up by the legs. Staff 2 then
stated to Youth A to let Staff 1 go, and then Youth A walked
out of the room.
• Written statements by several individuals involved in the
incident were reviewed, all dated 11/15/2023.
• Staff 1’s written statement is consistent with the
interview that he provided. It noted that Youth A did
not listen to his request to stop attempting to break
the time clock, that Staff 1 attempted to move Youth
A by the waist and then Youth A charged at Staff 1,
only for Staff 2 to ask him to stop and then Youth A
left the room.
• Staff 2’s written statement is consistent with the
interview that he provided. In it he stated that he
witnessed Staff 1 attempting to get in between the
time clock and Youth A, only for Youth A to grab
Staff 1. Staff 2 told Youth A to let go of Staff 1 and
Youth A left the room.
• Staff 3’s written statement is consistent with his
interview. Staff 3 stated that he did not see the
beginning of the incident and entered the room to
see Youth A and Staff 1 holding each other, with
Youth A then quickly leaving the room.
• Youth A’s written statement is consistent with his
interview. Youth A described that Staff 1 grabbed
him by the neck and stated, “Get your bitch ass out
of here.” Youth A stated that he pushed Staff 1 only
for Staff 1 to grab Youth A near his neck and push
Youth A against the wall.
• Facility policy titled “Behavior Support and Management
Policy'' dated 05/09/2023 was provided and reviewed. This
policy outlined the facilities chosen restraint model,
CPI. This described the approved techniques for physical
intervention with youth and none of the approved and
trained holds were described in interviews and
documentation provided.
5

Video Review:
• Video footage on 11/15/2023 was reviewed. This footage
came from a camera that is near the front entrance to the
building. This camera points toward that door from the
inside, and also looks into the staff break room at a slight
angle. A full view of that break room is not available. At
9:09am Staff 2 attempted to open the door to the staff
break room only for someone to open it from the inside. At
this point Staff 1 grabbed Youth A from the corner of the
room where the time clock is located and pulled him away
from that corner. At 9:09am Staff 1 was seen pushing
someone away from him. At 9:09 Staff 1 pushed Youth A
backwards towards the corner of the room. At this point
Staff 2 was inside the room. The door then closed from the
inside as Staff 3 approached it. Staff 3 opened the door
and Staff 1 could be seen in the corner of the room only
briefly where he had pushed Youth A. At 9:10am Staff 1
was seen moving in and out of view and he appeared to be
in a physical struggle with Youth A. Staff 3 then entered
the room and the door closed behind him, obstructing the
view of the camera. At 9:10am the door opened again from
the inside and Youth A then walked out with Staff 3
following.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff, and review of
documentation and video there was sufficient evidence found that
there was a rule violation related to the physical incident between
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 was observed to push Youth A.
Additionally, Staff 1 and Staff 2’s account of the incident is not
consistent in what is seen via video.
Technical Assistance provided:
• The facility is advised to locate and have fixed every door in
the building that is intended to be locked but may be
broken. The door that Youth A used that allowed him
access to a staff only area was broken and should not have
allowed him access.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000295 dated 01/18/2023, CAP approved 02/16/2023
SIR 2023C0000074 dated 01/18/2023; CAP approved 04/14/2023
SIR 2023C0000496 dated 08/08/2023, CAP approved 08/15/2023
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
